entry.et: Middle English, from Latin convenient-, conveniens, from present participle of convenire to assemble, come together, be suitable, from com- + venire to come come

def.dt: :suited to personal comfort or to easy performance meeting at a convenient time
:suited to a particular situation a convenient excuse
:affording accommodation or advantage found it convenient to deal with both problems at the same time
:being near at hand :close a location convenient to the train station
